title: Problem joining points in FontLab
content:
Okay, I'm sure there's a very simple answer to this, but I must ask. I'm new to FontLab and can't find answers on the web...

I'm wondering how to connect two points that are on different paths. Every time I try to the program won't allow it, but will only on the same path. See attached image, I'm trying to join the two top points, and the lower 2 points. Any thoughts?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203084016im_/http:/typophile.com/files/B_5185.jpg)
author: shn

comments.content:
Click with Drawing tool (pen with plus sign) in the first node. Pen is showing a diagonal line instead of a cross.

Click with same tool in the second node. Pen is showing a circle.

Path closed.

If it is a straight path, you can just drag and drop one of the poinys on the other.

ChrisL

thanks! the drag/drop method worked, the other did not. only allows me to join points on the same node (no circle on the outer path).

[WSDIA | WeShouldDoItAll](http://web.archive.org/)

Oh, it is fine. The important thing is that the problem is solved. ;)

Good luck!

Also, though I'm not entirely sure: I think if your 'snap-to-grid' is set to 1 it's tough to do several things, because FL uses that variable for a more than what you think it should? :-)

Cheers!
